â€¢	Good to have skills : OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM), Experience in Java, .NET, or other programming languages

â€¢	Design, build and configure applications to meet business process and application requirements. 
â€¢	Must have skills : OpenText ECM Tools 
â€¢	Good to have skills : OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM) 
â€¢	As an Application Developer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and configuring applications to meet business process and application requirements using OpenText ECM Tools. 
â€¢	Roles & Responsibilities: - Design, build, and configure applications to meet business process and application requirements using OpenText ECM Tools. 
â€¢	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze business requirements and develop solutions to meet those requirements.
enhanced_versions:
Role Overview:
This role is responsible for designing, building, and configuring enterprise-level content management applications using OpenText Content Server. As a key member of the development team, you will leverage your expertise in OpenText technologies to deliver innovative solutions that streamline business processes and enhance organizational efficiency. Your deep understanding of the OpenText ecosystem, combined with your proficiency in programming and workflow management, will be instrumental in driving the successful implementation and adoption of these critical applications.

Key Responsibilities:
- Design, build, and configure robust content management applications using OpenText Content Server, including workflows, LiveReports, Forms, WebReports, and Oscript
- Develop custom solutions to meet complex business requirements, leveraging your expertise in XSL transformation and other advanced OpenText features
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business analysts and subject matter experts, to gather requirements and translate them into effective technology solutions
- Continuously expand your knowledge of the OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM) suite, staying up-to-date with the latest features and best practices
- Provide technical guidance and support to end-users, ensuring the smooth operation and adoption of the implemented solutions
- Participate in the ongoing maintenance, optimization, and enhancement of the OpenText Content Server environment

Required Skills:
- Proficient in designing and developing applications using OpenText Content Server, with a strong understanding of its core components and capabilities
- Expertise in XSL transformation, workflows, LiveReports, Forms, WebReports, and Oscript development
- Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions
- Strong communication and collaboration skills, enabling you to work effectively with cross-functional teams
- Familiarity with programming languages such as Java, .NET, or other relevant technologies

Preferred Skills:
- Experience in the broader OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM) suite, including integration with other EIM products
- Knowledge of software development methodologies and best practices, such as Agile or DevOps
- Familiarity with user experience (UX) design principles and their application in enterprise content management solutions

Required Experience:
- Minimum of 5 years of experience in Opentext Content Server development
- Demonstrated experience in designing, building, and configuring complex content management applications
- Track record of successfully delivering projects that meet business requirements and drive organizational efficiency

Preferred Experience:
- Experience as an OpenText GCI expert, with proficiency in the GCI Power tool for Document Template module
- Prior experience in a similar role, working with cross-functional teams to implement enterprise-wide content management solutions

Tools & Technologies:
- OpenText Content Server
- XSL transformation
- Workflows, LiveReports, Forms, WebReports, and Oscript
- Java, .NET, or other programming languages
- OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM) suite

Work Environment & Expectations:
- Collaborative and agile development environment, with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation
- Participation in cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and ensure successful implementation
- Commitment to staying up-to-date with the latest OpenText technologies and best practices
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions

Role Overview:
As an OpenText Content Server Application Developer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the enterprise content management landscape of our organization. Leveraging your deep expertise in the OpenText ecosystem, you will design, build, and configure innovative solutions that streamline business processes, enhance data governance, and empower our workforce to work more efficiently. Your ability to translate complex requirements into practical, user-friendly applications will be instrumental in driving the adoption and success of our OpenText initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:
- Develop custom applications and workflows within the OpenText Content Server platform to meet the unique needs of our business units
- Implement advanced features such as XSL transformation, LiveReports, Forms, WebReports, and Oscript to create tailored content management solutions
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including subject matter experts and business stakeholders, to gather requirements and design effective technology-driven solutions
- Provide technical expertise and guidance to end-users, ensuring the smooth operation and adoption of the implemented applications
- Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM) suite, incorporating new features and best practices into your work
- Participate in the ongoing maintenance, optimization, and enhancement of the OpenText Content Server environment

Required Skills:
- Comprehensive understanding of the OpenText Content Server platform and its core components
- Proficiency in designing and developing applications using XSL transformation, workflows, LiveReports, Forms, WebReports, and Oscript
- Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into technical solutions
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills, enabling you to work effectively with cross-functional teams
- Familiarity with programming languages such as Java, .NET, or other relevant technologies

Preferred Skills:
- Knowledge of the broader OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM) suite and its integration capabilities
- Experience in software development methodologies and best practices, such as Agile or DevOps
- Understanding of user experience (UX) design principles and their application in enterprise content management solutions

Required Experience:
- Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in Opentext Content Server development
- Proven track record of designing, building, and configuring complex content management applications that meet business requirements
- Successful delivery of projects that have driven organizational efficiency and improved data governance

Preferred Experience:
- Experience as an OpenText GCI expert, with proficiency in the GCI Power tool for Document Template module
- Prior experience in a similar role, working with cross-functional teams to implement enterprise-wide content management solutions

Tools & Technologies:
- OpenText Content Server
- XSL transformation
- Workflows, LiveReports, Forms, WebReports, and Oscript
- Java, .NET, or other programming languages
- OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM) suite

Work Environment & Expectations:
- Collaborative and agile development environment, with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation
- Participation in cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and ensure successful implementation
- Commitment to staying up-to-date with the latest OpenText technologies and best practices
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions that drive organizational efficiency and data governance

Role Overview:
This role is an exciting opportunity for an experienced OpenText Content Server Application Developer to join our dynamic team and make a significant impact on our organization's content management strategy. As a key member of our development group, you will leverage your deep expertise in the OpenText ecosystem to design, build, and configure innovative solutions that streamline business processes, enhance data governance, and empower our workforce to work more efficiently. Your ability to translate complex requirements into practical, user-friendly applications will be instrumental in driving the adoption and success of our OpenText initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:
- Develop custom applications and workflows within the OpenText Content Server platform to meet the unique needs of our business units
- Implement advanced features such as XSL transformation, LiveReports, Forms, WebReports, and Oscript to create tailored content management solutions
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including subject matter experts and business stakeholders, to gather requirements and design effective technology-driven solutions
- Provide technical expertise and guidance to end-users, ensuring the smooth operation and adoption of the implemented applications
- Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM) suite, incorporating new features and best practices into your work
- Participate in the ongoing maintenance, optimization, and enhancement of the OpenText Content Server environment

Required Skills:
- Comprehensive understanding of the OpenText Content Server platform and its core components
- Proficiency in designing and developing applications using XSL transformation, workflows, LiveReports, Forms, WebReports, and Oscript
- Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into technical solutions
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills, enabling you to work effectively with cross-functional teams
- Familiarity with programming languages such as Java, .NET, or other relevant technologies

Preferred Skills:
- Knowledge of the broader OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM) suite and its integration capabilities
- Experience in software development methodologies and best practices, such as Agile or DevOps
- Understanding of user experience (UX) design principles and their application in enterprise content management solutions

Required Experience:
- Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in Opentext Content Server development
- Proven track record of designing, building, and configuring complex content management applications that meet business requirements
- Successful delivery of projects that have driven organizational efficiency and improved data governance

Preferred Experience:
- Experience as an OpenText GCI expert, with proficiency in the GCI Power tool for Document Template module
- Prior experience in a similar role, working with cross-functional teams to implement enterprise-wide content management solutions

Tools & Technologies:
- OpenText Content Server
- XSL transformation
- Workflows, LiveReports, Forms, WebReports, and Oscript
- Java, .NET, or other programming languages
- OpenText Enterprise Information Management (EIM) suite

Work Environment & Expectations:
- Collaborative and agile development environment, with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation
- Participation in cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and ensure successful implementation
- Commitment to staying up-to-date with the latest OpenText technologies and best practices
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions that drive organizational efficiency and data governance
